alert.note: Alert for Central Lea County; Eddy County Plains; Northern Lea County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:29AM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN EDDY AND NORTHERN LEA COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM MDT... At 129 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Maljamar, or 29 miles west of Lovington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lovington and Maljamar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Lea County; Eddy County Plains; Northern Lea County
